labels.analysis: The MCP Server primarily functions as an integration tool for Airtable, allowing users to interact with Airtable bases and tables using natural language commands. This enables querying, creating, updating, and deleting records directly from AI tools, eliminating the need for manual data entry or traditional interface use. The core functionality revolves around efficient data management and AI-driven Airtable interactions, enhancing productivity for AI-powered applications.
labels.reasoning: The primary tag is "Database Operations" because the server directly interfaces with Airtable databases to manage records. Secondary labels include "AI/ML Tools" due to its natural language processing capabilities and "Daily Productivity" as it streamlines data management tasks. No custom label is needed as the functionality is well-covered by predefined categories.

server_info_crawled.name: Airtable Integration Tool
server_info_crawled.author: @mufonix/airtable-mcp
server_info_crawled.overview: Connect your AI tools directly to Airtable to query, create, update, and delete records using natural language. Manage your Airtable bases and tables effortlessly through a standardized interface, enhancing your productivity in AI-powered applications.

tools.name: Optional Settings
tools.description: Access and manage servers by signing in.

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@mufonix/airtable-mcp/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
